verses.verse: He that is wounded in the stones <S%H6481><s%>, or hath his privy member <S%H8212><s%> cut off <S%H3772><s%>, shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the assembly <S%H6951><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

A bastard <S%H4464><s%> shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the assembly <S%H6951><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; even to the tenth <S%H6224><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> shall none of his enter <S%H935><s%> into the assembly <S%H6951><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

An Ammonite <S%H5984><s%> or a Moabite <S%H4125><s%> shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the assembly <S%H6951><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; even to the tenth <S%H6224><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> shall none belonging to them enter <S%H935><s%> into the assembly <S%H6951><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> for <S%H5704><s%> ever <S%H5769><s%>:

because <S%H1697><s%> they met <S%H6923><s%> you not with bread <S%H3899><s%> and with water <S%H4325><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%>, when ye came forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and because they hired <S%H7936><s%> against thee Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> from Pethor <S%H6604><s%> of Mesopotamia <S%H763><s%>, to curse thee <S%H7043><s%>.

Nevertheless Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto Balaam <S%H1109><s%>; but Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> turned <S%H2015><s%> the curse <S%H7045><s%> into a blessing <S%H1293><s%> unto thee <S%H3068><s%>, because Jehovah thy God <S%H430><s%> loved thee <S%H157><s%>.
Thou shalt not seek <S%H1875><s%> their peace <S%H7965><s%> nor their prosperity <S%H2896><s%> all thy days <S%H3117><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>.

Thou shalt not abhor <S%H8581><s%> an Edomite <S%H130><s%>; for he is thy brother <S%H251><s%>: thou shalt not abhor <S%H8581><s%> an Egyptian <S%H4713><s%>, because thou wast a sojourner <S%H1616><s%> in his land <S%H776><s%>.
The children <S%H1121><s%> of the third <S%H7992><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> that are born <S%H3205><s%> unto them shall enter <S%H935><s%> into the assembly <S%H6951><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.
When thou goest forth <S%H3318><s%> in camp <S%H4264><s%> against thine enemies <S%H341><s%>, then thou shalt keep <S%H8104><s%> thee from every evil <S%H7451><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%>.

If there be among you any man <S%H376><s%>, that is not clean <S%H2889><s%> by reason of that which chanceth <S%H7137><s%> him by night <S%H3915><s%>, then shall he go <S%H3318><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%> out of the camp <S%H4264><s%>, he shall not come <S%H935><s%> within <S%H8432><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%>:

but it shall be <S%H6153><s%>, when evening cometh on <S%H6437><s%>, he shall bathe <S%H7364><s%> himself in water <S%H4325><s%>; and when the sun <S%H8121><s%> is down <S%H935><s%>, he shall come <S%H935><s%> within <S%H8432><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%>.
Thou shalt have a place also <S%H3027><s%> without <S%H2351><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%>, whither thou shalt go forth <S%H3318><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%>:

and thou shalt have a paddle <S%H3489><s%> among thy weapons <S%H240><s%>; and it shall be <S%H3427><s%>, when thou sittest down abroad <S%H2351><s%>, thou shalt dig <S%H2658><s%> therewith <S%H7725><s%>, and shalt turn back and cover <S%H3680><s%> that which cometh from thee <S%H6627><s%>:

for Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> walketh <S%H1980><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of thy camp <S%H4264><s%>, to deliver <S%H5337><s%> thee <S%H5414><s%>, and to give up thine enemies <S%H341><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> thee <S%H4264><s%>; therefore shall thy camp be holy <S%H6918><s%>, that he may not see <S%H7200><s%> an unclean <S%H6172><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> in thee <S%H7725><s%>, and turn away from thee <S%H310><s%>.
Thou shalt not deliver <S%H5462><s%> unto his master <S%H113><s%> a servant <S%H5650><s%> that is escaped <S%H5337><s%> from his master unto thee <S%H113><s%>:

he shall dwell <S%H3427><s%> with thee <S%H7130><s%>, in the midst of thee <S%H4725><s%>, in the place which he shall choose <S%H977><s%> within one <S%H259><s%> of thy gates <S%H8179><s%>, where it pleaseth him best <S%H2896><s%>: thou shalt not oppress him <S%H3238><s%>.
There shall be no prostitute <S%H6948><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, neither shall there be a sodomite <S%H6945><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

Thou shalt not bring <S%H935><s%> the hire <S%H868><s%> of a harlot <S%H2181><s%>, or the wages <S%H4242><s%> of a dog <S%H3611><s%>, into the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> for any vow <S%H5088><s%>: for even both <S%H8147><s%> these are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>.

Thou shalt not lend upon interest <S%H5391><s%> to thy brother <S%H251><s%>; interest <S%H5391><s%> of money <S%H3701><s%>, interest <S%H5392><s%> of victuals <S%H400><s%>, interest <S%H5392><s%> of anything <S%H1697><s%> that is lent upon interest <S%H5391><s%>:

unto a foreigner <S%H5237><s%> thou mayest lend upon interest <S%H5391><s%>; but unto thy brother <S%H251><s%> thou shalt not lend upon interest <S%H5391><s%>, that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> may bless <S%H1288><s%> thee in all that thou puttest <S%H4916><s%> thy hand <S%H3027><s%> unto <S%H776><s%>, in the land whither thou goest <S%H935><s%> in to possess it <S%H3423><s%>.

When thou shalt vow <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>, thou shalt not be slack <S%H309><s%> to pay <S%H7999><s%> it <S%H3068><s%>: for Jehovah thy God <S%H430><s%> will surely <S%H1875><s%> require <S%H1875><s%> it of thee <S%H2399><s%>; and it would be sin in thee.
But if thou shalt forbear <S%H2308><s%> to vow <S%H5087><s%>, it shall be no sin in thee <S%H2399><s%>.

That which is gone out <S%H4161><s%> of thy lips <S%H8193><s%> thou shalt observe <S%H8104><s%> and do <S%H6213><s%>; according as thou hast vowed <S%H5087><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>, a freewill-offering <S%H5071><s%>, which thou hast promised <S%H1696><s%> with thy mouth <S%H6310><s%>.

When thou comest <S%H935><s%> into thy neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s vineyard <S%H3754><s%>, then thou mayest eat <S%H398><s%> of grapes <S%H6025><s%> thy fill <S%H7648><s%> at thine own pleasure <S%H5315><s%>; but thou shalt not put <S%H5414><s%> any in thy vessel <S%H3627><s%>.

When thou comest <S%H935><s%> into thy neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s standing grain <S%H7054><s%>, then thou mayest pluck <S%H6998><s%> the ears <S%H4425><s%> with thy hand <S%H3027><s%>; but thou shalt not move <S%H5130><s%> a sickle <S%H2770><s%> unto thy neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s standing grain <S%H7054><s%>.
